title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.60 - Executive Order No. 60: Terminating Executive Order No. 14 in relation to Suffolk County
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.60 - Executive Order No. 60: Terminating Executive Order No. 14 in relation to Suffolk County

State Regulations
WHEREAS, on the twelfth day of September, nineteen hundred
seventy-five, at the request of the District Attorney of Suffolk County, Henry
F. O'Brien, I made a requirement upon you in relation to Suffolk County, embodied in Executive Order Number 14; and
WHEREAS, on the eleventh day of December, nineteen hundred
seventy-five and on the twentieth day of July, nineteen hundred seventy-six, I
issued amendments to said requirement, embodied in Executive Orders Numbered
14.1 and 14.2, respectively, and
WHEREAS, the Special Deputy Attorney General in charge of
the Suffolk County Investigation, Alfred J. Scotti, has reported to me, by
letter dated July 27, 1977, that all matters relating to the Suffolk County

Investigation have been completed, and that the two Special Grand Juries
empaneled for the purposes of that investigation have been discharged, and
WHEREAS, the continuation of said requirement is no longer
necessary, NOW, THEREFORE, I hereby terminate the requirement upon you
dated the twelfth day of September, nineteen hundred seventy-five, embodied in

Executive Order Number 14, and the amendments to said requirement issued on the
eleventh day of December, nineteen hundred seventy-five and the twentieth day
of July, nineteen hundred seventy-six, embodied in Executive Orders Numbered
14.1 and 14.2, respectively, effective this date. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: October 11, 1977

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
3.60

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
